Relationship between STATUS and STATE
Overview

STATE is one of the most significant influencers of STATUS and displays significant variation in distribution of STATUS categories. The top 4 STATES including segment Virginia and segment Florida account for 90.4% of the total observations. Segment New York is the smallest with just 9.61% of the total observations.
Key segments of STATUS - Churn

The percentage contribution of STATUS - Churn is the lowest for the segment New York (11.1%). The segment Ohio has the highest contribution of STATUS - Churn (32.5%), which is 192.1% higher than segment New York and 30.7% higher than the overall.

• The segment Florida and segment New York, which cumulatively account for 34.6% of the total observations, has contributed to 22.6% of the segment Churn.
  • The segment Virginia accounts for 26.3% of the total observations, but it has contributed to 33.9% of the segment Churn.
Key segments of STATUS - Active

When it comes to STATUS - Active, segment Ohio seems to be the least dominant segment since 67.5% of its total observations are into that Active category. But, segment New York has the highest contribution of STATUS - Active (88.9%).

• The segment Virginia and segment Ohio, which cumulatively account for 46.5% of the total observations, have contributed to 41.9% of the segment Active.
  • The segment Florida accounts for 25.0% of the total observations, but it has contributed to 27.2% of the segment Active.

Relationship between STATUS and BILL_AMOUNT_DECEMBER
Overview

BILL_AMOUNT_DECEMBER is one of the most significant influencers of STATUS and displays significant variation in distribution of STATUS categories. Segment Less than $1000 and segment $1000 to $5000 are the two largest BILL_AMOUNT_DECEMBER, accounting for 92.3% of the total observations. Segment $10000 to $20000 is the smallest with just 0.8% of the total observations.
Key segments of STATUS - Churn

The percentage contribution of STATUS - Churn is the lowest for the segment $5000 to $10000 (19.2%). The segment $10000 to $20000 has the highest contribution of STATUS - Churn (66.7%), which is 246.7% higher than segment $5000 to $10000 and 168.5% higher than the overall.

• The segment $5000 to $10000, which accounts for 6.9% of the total observations, has contributed to 5.4% of the segment Churn.
  • The segment $10000 to $20000 accounts for 0.8% of the total observations, but it has contributed to 2.2% of the segment Churn.
Key segments of STATUS - Active

When it comes to STATUS - Active, segment Less than $1000 seems to be the least dominant segment since 74.9% of its total observations are into that Active category. But, segment $5000 to $10000 has the highest contribution of STATUS - Active (80.8%).

• The segment $10000 to $20000, which accounts for 0.8% of the total observations, has contributed to 0.4% of the segment Active.
  • The segment $5000 to $10000 accounts for 6.9% of the total observations, but it has contributed to 7.5% of the segment Active.
